History

  • Birth at Netscape
  • Beta releases of Netscape Navigator 2.0 in September 1995
  • Netscape wanted a lightweight interpreted language that would complement Java by appealing to nonprofessional programmers, like Microsoft's Visual Basic
  • Mocha -> LiveScript -> JavaScript

Language Concepts

  • Imperative ans structured
  • Dynamic typing
  • Object based
  • Run-time evaluation
  • First-class functions
  • Prototype-based : Functions as object constructors, Functions as methods
  • Implicit and Explicit Delegation
  • Regular expressions
